comment: Beautiful dark blend, definitely has a good amount of Yamazaki in it. Well-balanced, sweet, fruity and a little bit smoky. 92

Nose - Very light fruity/floral vanilla, light caramel, hints of Asian pear, carambola (star fruit).

Taste - Fairly thin and light, pear/white grape juice, floral, light balanced fruity bittersweet like that of a pomelo pith, gentle woody/spice tingle.

Finish - Light lingering wood/spice tingle, fruity & floral notes remain, more Asian pear & carambola along w/ fading pomelo pith bittersweet.

Score - 81/100

Final Thoughts - This one screams Japanese blend. Flavors are very light, well put together, nothing offensive, but subtle. Fairly boring on the nose, but very floral & almost gentle purfume-like. I have a feeling this is best served neat as it seems like it would very quickly disappear in a highball or any other mixture. Very light & gentle summery feel, something you can sip on and quickly forget about. Nothing off-putting but at the same time nothing really memorable.
Malty, sweet, woody, complex. Bourbony sweetness and spice without overdoing it. Really interesting and tasty. Pipe tobacco on the nose. Old wet oak notes.
2019-4-9 SR Royal 60th anniversary.  smooth and buttery tastes sherry little of toffee. Smells clearly of tobacco- extinguished pipe
пахнет жестко, прям ацетоном,  но вкус довольно мягкий
Very rich and oily like I like. Sweet and nutty flavors, full bodied, tail spreads into a pleasant nuttiness that lingers a long time. wonderful.

I saw this Suntory Royal bottle at a friend's house and when he said "pick any bottle" i obviously went for the "old looking Suntory", thinking of course that it was the hardest one to find. The result: a not too enjoyable dram that is easily forgotten.

On the nose: Grain whisky right from the start. Lemon, dry cake, Yeast, raw rice. Very similar to haig club. 

On the palate: spice, butter and corn. Not good. Aftertaste is short with yeast notes. 

Basically a grain whisky, this one could be avoided. 68/100.
Delicious- my brother got me a bottle directly from Japan and it’s a caramel soaked beauty.

Pleasant on the nose with a touch of woody sweetness.
The sweetness builds up to a toffee like taste when you breath out. Not without just a touch of spice to let you know how complex it actually is.
